title: Zwift vs TrainerRoad: Which is better for you? (Both?)

transcript.full_text: I'm so excited I got two new bikes today look a time trial bike and a road bike how perfect is that oh wait wrong video today we're here to compare two indoor cycling apps zwift and trainer Road hi my name is Alex and I'm the creator of trainer day a product similar to trainer Road in this video my goal is to provide a quick honest and fair comparison of both zwift and trainer Road stick around for the end to hear what I feel are the most important differences between the two let's start with a quick overview zwift allows cyclists to ride in a virtual 3D World and compete with other cyclists in real time trainer Road focuses on structured workouts and training plans that Target specific aspects of cycling performance trainerroad also provides detailed data and analytics to enable users to track their progress and make informed decisions about their training zwift has a more social and immersive aspect that allows users to connect with other cyclists as well as join group brides and raises as a performance cyclist I think the final and most important reason to choose one or the other comes to this you need to find out which app inspires you to stay consistent and if you are consistent which one drives you towards smarter training if you're consistently writing at least six hours a week science has shown that your likely to see your best results if you include a significant amount of low intensity endurance rides neither of these apps are perfectly optimized for easy rides so make sure you mix in your own low intensity rides zwift can be addictive and it may encourage you to race frequently even if that just means trying to keep up with that cute Avatar passing you by too much intensity negatively impacts recovery this is especially true if you find yourself lacking self-control to hold back like trainer Road zwift also provides ERG mode and structured workouts ERG mode forces your self-control by setting your power intensity for you regardless of your gearing or Cadence I and many others feel that ERG mode and zwift is frustrating I pedal along watching guys or gals that are slower than me pass me by I all also end up going dreadfully slow uphill during rest intervals if you have good self-control and the feeling slow does not bother you then the downsides of zwift may not affect you I feel now is the time to say that hundreds or even thousands of cyclists have reported performance improvements after transitioning from zwift to trainer Road these gains are likely due to breaking out of their usual riding patterns and having more structure to their training as a past zwift writer myself I really like zwift but I eventually got bored with the video game aspect and realized I prefer listening to audiobooks music or watching Netflix but I will say I still enjoy zwift from time to time one of the negatives of trainer road that you hear users reporting is that many workouts and plans are too hard causing workout failure or seasonal burnout trainer Road has a new Dynamic Training Method called train now which may help reduce this problem additionally many coaches feel that too much time in ERG mode is not optimal they recommend you spend as much time as you can outside as well as doing some of your indoor interval sessions in slope mode by feel if you want to learn the differences between trainer Road and trainer day click on the video link above not sure which way one of those two what's great is you can't go wrong with any of these products see which one works best for you thanks for watching
